title: For Sale/Trade:  Rifles for Sale (Winchester, Springfield, Lee Enfield)
postcontent:
-Winchester Ranger 30-30

Solid rifle, good shape, and great shooter. Used the past few deer seasons. Not really much else to say about it, what you see is what you get. Winchester quality -$275

-1945 Springfield M1 Garand

Manufactured in 1945, all original parts, saw combat in early Vietnam. It has some wear on it, but considering the age and what all the rifle has seen, it's not only expected but adds a lot of character to the gun. The rifle shoots OUTSTANDING, very well taken care of, passed down through the family for a while now. Included with the rifle are ten stripper clips, two ammo belts, and an ammo sling -$800

-Lee Enfield .303

Very cool rifle, very rare in the fact that it still has the original stock, not sporterized like you see most of the time now days. Good shooter, clean bore, just a good all-around rifle -$300


Just shoot me an email and let me know if you're interested in buying or trading or maybe a littl bit of both, I'm pretty easy to work with. I'm pretty firm with the prices, but depending on what you have I will definitely work with you as far as trades and everything goes. It's not my goal to try and short-change anyone, I like dealing with happy people who appreciate guns as much as I do. The main thing is no junk, I am offering quality firearms and would like the same respect if you're interested in any of them. I appreciate it guys, have a good one

title: For Sale:  SALE PENDING CZ 75 P-07 Duty 9mm
postcontent:
Purchased as first gun for my son and he isn't interested in a pistol.  His loss your gain.  New in the box, purchased 5.07.12; yep less than two weeks ago and I do have the receipt to prove it.

This pistol grip is only .07 inches wider than a Sig P239.  The Sig is a 9 round pistol, the C is a 16 round pistol.  Amazing for a CCW.

OEM Comments
Don't let the "Duty" designation trick you. The P-07 model is a compact handgun -- just as appropriate for concealed carry as it is for uniformed duty.  The abbreviated 3.8" barrel and compact grip allow the Duty to disappear under clothing much more easily than full-sized models. This compact size and polymer frame along with the new slide profile (fully machined from bar stock) reduce weight, making the P-07 Duty a great choice for concealed carry. Easily adaptable to low light use, the Duty features an accessory rail to which a light or laser can be attached.

When designing the polymer frame for the Duty, the decision was made to retain the basic grip shape (circumference, angle, etc.) so popular in the CZ 75 family of handguns. The polymer frame platform eliminated the need for the grip panels that are used on most steel and alloy-framed autos. The absence of the grips resulted in some available space that was used to increase the magazine capacity by 2 rounds. The results speak for themselves -- the flush-fitting magazine of the P-07 Duty holds the same number of rounds that the full-sized versions of the CZ 75 do in both 9mm and .40 S&W.

The most innovative feature of the P-07 duty is the Omega trigger system. The new mechanism was first introduced on the P-07 model. It simplifies the CZ 75 trigger system, uses fewer parts and improves the trigger pull, but the real story is in the versatility it provides for its owner. The Omega system allows users to choose between operating the handgun with a decocking lever (installed) or a manual safety (included) by a simple parts change.

You can argue the fact that these cost right at 300$ stock with nothing but most ppl end up getting the extra accessories on it anyway because they are cheap and is fun to customize. This gun has never jammed and i have it sighted at 50 yards dead on. Ammo is cheap being 9mm luger rounds. Just an all around fun gun to shoot. Only reason I am selling it is because I want a new trap gun so Im getting rid of some of my guns for a brand new BT99, being that i might shoot the hi point once every three months or so and I trap shoot every saturday its worth it to me to get rid of this very fun gun. title: For Sale:  CETME with stainless cast reciever
postcontent:
Up for sale is a fairly rare example of the popular CETME line of rifles. This rifles has a stainless steel cast receiver, not stamped. Also it is uncommon due to the fact that it also has no muzzle device. To my knowledge only a handful of these with cast receivers where made without any muzzle device to address NY firearm laws.   

I've had this rifle for a few years and I've fired roughly 200 rounds through it. It functions flawlessly and is very fun. It's rock solid and seems invincible. 

The rifle is in very good condition with beautiful wood grain in the stock, the bore is bright and shines like a mirror. The steel is about 95% with some minor scuffs and scratches. The rear sight aperture wheel is a bit looser then it should be, but it still holds still when you shoot.

Shipping is no problem.

postcontent:
$150 OBO 
I have a Jimenez 380 that I purchased new from Indy Trading Post.  I know they are a fairly cheap gun, and I only purchased it to shoot it and do a review on my youtube channel, I have many others for my personal collection.  This is not a gun that I purchased because I wanted a quick gun and now I am unhappy or anything of that nature. I always hear people talk down about them, but I wanted to see if the hype was true.  I figured for the price it would make a good youtube review.  Believe it or not the gun fired federal ammo flawlessly, and when I ran out of federal I fired about 50 rds of tulammo to really try and jam it, NOTHING!  The gun is really awesome for a small conceal 380.  They have a great lifetime warrenty, and it is heavy enough for a small gun that it doesn't kick like some of the smaller lighter poly 380's, this makes it a little easier to control.  I paid $159, plus about $11 dollars tax, and I am selling it for $10 dollars cheaper minus the tax to help someone out. title: For Sale:  Kimber Pro Carry .45ACP (***Pre-Series II***)
postcontent:
***Private Sale / Privately Owned Firearm***

***You must be legally eligible to own/purchase/possess firearms under federal and state law in order to purchase this handgun***

Email through Armslist.

Located in Bailey.  I may be able to meet in the Conifer/Aspen Park area.

_______________

This is a highly desirable, pre-Series II Kimber Pro Carry.  For those who don't know Kimber started installing a firing pin block safety on the Series II guns.  This one was built like a 1911 was meant to be built...no firing pin block.  It has a very nice trigger, a 4" barrel, alloy frame and Meprolight night sights that are still bright and serviceable.  This gun includes the original Kimber case (the sticker is gone, though), the little Kimber take-down tool, owner's manual and 3 Kimber mags.  

It does show some signs of use but nothing serious (other than the idiot mark under the slide-lock lever).  Someone polished the feed ramp at some point but it appears to be fairly light.  The screw slot on the lower, left-side grip screw bushing is chewed up a little but nothing that affects the gun or that you can see.  Just wanted to mention that in the interest of full disclosure.

The gun functions perfectly with all types of ammo except CCI Blazer (aluminum).  It just WILL NOT feed Blazer ammo.  Everything else I've tried works great and the gun is very accurate.  

This gun is in remarkably good shape considering it's probably 11+ years old.

No trades.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Argentine colt 1911a
postcontent:
Please text me at REDACTED
The Gun was manufactured in 1948
The Gun is in great shape as it is all orginally with the exception of the Grips.  The gun has matching serial numbers on the upper, lower, and barrell.  The blue book on the gun is valued at $800 -$1200 

Here is some background on the 1911 firearms known as "Systema Colt" [ sister colt ].

In 1927, the Argentine Commission for Foreign Acquisitions negotiated a contract with Colt for the manufacture of M1911A1 .45 caliber self-loading pistols 
SISTEMA COLTS
For production of Colt 1911A1's in Argentina, Colt engineers supervised the set-up of the production equipment.

Sistema Colts were manufactured in accordance with Colt's 1927 drawings. The pistols were made for the Argentine Army, Navy, Air Force, government bureaus, police, commercial sales, and export. .

Sistema Colts were made from forged steel and will be just as long-lived and reliable as their Hartford counterparts. The German, British, and Swedish steel used in their manufacture was the best available. They are regarded as 100% Colt pistols, "Fully USGI," according to one opinion, "in fit, finish, form, and function.".

Numbers Produced at FMAP Rosario and Serial #s, 1945-1966
1945 - 6,000 - #24,001 - #30,000
1946 - 7,628 - #30,001 - #37,628
1947 - 5,000 - #37,629 - #42,628
1948 - 7,000 - #42,629 - #49,628
1949 - 5,000 - #49,629 - #54,628

The Ruger 10/22 is one of the most popular 22 rifles in the world and many beginning shooters learn the basics of target shooting with this handy little carbine. 

This Red Dot scope is especially suitable for youngsters as they only have to place the red dot on the target and squeeze the trigger.  It can be used with both eyes open and the unlimited eye relief feature allows it to be mounted any distance from the shooter’s eyes as the shooter likes. 

The smaller scope profile makes it easier to carry your Ruger 10/22 in the field or fit it into a scabbard or gun case.

SCOPE SPECIFICATIONS:
+ Magnification: 1X
+ Reticle: Illuminated 3 MOA Red Dot

postcontent:
KEELY ENTERPRISES

Kahr PM9 (Blemished)...New in box
NO credit card fees!

Caliber: 9mm
Capacity: 6+1, 7+1 (magazine with grip extension)
Operation: Trigger cocking DAO; lock breech; "Browning - type" recoil lug; passive striker block; no magazine disconnect
Barrel: 3.1", polygonal rifling; 1 - 10 right-hand twist
Length O/A: 5.42"
Height: 4.0"
Slide Width: .90"
Weight: Pistol 14 ounces, Magazine 1.9 ounces
Grips: Textured polymer
Sights: Drift adjustable, white bar-dot combat sights
Finish: Black polymer frame, matte stainless steel slide 
Magazines: 1 each: 6 rd flush floorplate & 7 rd extended grip

ABOUT US
We are a new FFL dealer located in Central Ohio. For years we have been selling holsters and other various accessories, but we are now excited to begin selling to you all of your favorite AR style rifles and semi-auto pistols. If you are looking for a particular gun that we do not have listed, please feel free to contact us and we will try our best to help you find it.

OUR POLICIES
Payment
Visa, MasterCard, Discover credit cards accepted with no additional fees. Payment can be made through the auction sites shopping cart, if available. If not, we will send a link to our website's Auction/classified Listing Payment link, so that you can make a secure credit card payment.
NO ADDITIONAL FEES for credit card payments. In fact, we encourage it because it is safer and more secure for all parties involved 
Ohio residents will be charged 7.0% sales tax
Transactions requiring FFL's
Please have your FFL dealer fax or email a signed, legible copy within 5 days of the purchase to us
Fax to REDACTED
Make sure the FFL holder includes your name on the fax or email
We will include a copy of our FFL with the shipment

Shipping
We will ship handguns via USPS Priority mail, other items may vary
Shipping rates and free shipping offers are for the contiguous 48 states. Additional fees for Alaska and Hawaii
All shipments of firearms will be insured and tracking number will be provided
Will not ship to  MD, NY, NJ, Washington DC
It is the buyer's responsibility to make sure the item purchased is legal in their area
We WILL ship to CA if the item is on the approved list and meets the state's requirements. Shipping times may increase by a couple days due to the additional paperwork required.
Warranties/Returns
New firearms carry the warranty from the manufacturer
Used firearms are sold As Is
If for some reason you believe the item you received is not as we represented, please contact us. We want you to be happy with your purchase!

Questions
We strongly encourage you to contact us if you have any questions regarding an item you may wish to purchase. We want to make sure you have confidence in your purchase.
Our products are also for sale locally and we reserve the right to end the sale/auction early as long as there are no bids over any set reserve price.
New gun listings may use stock photos. Serial numbers in pictures may not be the same as the gun shipped.


THANKS AND HAPPY BUYING!!

title: For Sale:  Mossberg 500 home defense shotgun
postcontent:
For sale is my Mossberg 500, which I have built into a home defense/multipurpose shotgun. This shotgun only has about two dozen shells through it, basically decided I am going a different route and could use the money to fund other things around the house.

This shotgun started life as a field gun, with a 28" vent rib barrel that is still unfired. I installed the Phoenix Technologies Kick-Lite stock, TacStar saddle, UTG receiver rail, and 18.5" cylinder bore barrel to build it in to an HD gun that could be converted back if I wanted to hunt turkey or shoot skeet. Shot the gun one day, a dozen or so low brass target loads and a dozen high brass 00BK and slugs just to check the function, and have decided that I really don't need this gun right now so it's going on the board.

Photos: http://imgur.com/a/ADIoi

What's included in the sale:
Mossberg 500 shotgun
Phoenix Technologies Kick-Lite stock
TacStar 4-shell side-saddle (so it doesn't have to be removed if you want to install the wood furniture)
UTG receiver rail
Tasco Red Dot sight (has actually done quite well so far)
Original wood furniture in excellent condition (has the stock with the two interchangable combs for cheek height)
Original 28" vent rib barrel in unfired condition, with the original three chokes included)
Original box and lock
Plano Pillarlock single scoped rifle case
90rds #8 target loads
10rds #4 bird
15rds 00BK
5rds 1oz. rifled slug

I have over $550 invested in this gun and will sell it at a big loss right now.

title: For Sale:  Ruger M77 Mark II 300 win mag stainless
postcontent:
This is a really nice Ruger M77 Mark II stainless with the lightweight composite stock and a 10x40x50 Tasco World Class scope chambered in 300 Winchester Magnum.  It is in great shape. I haven't shot it much. I have taken about ten deer with it at one shot per deer. Original zeroing used less than 40 rounds and anual zero check at about 6 shots.  So maybe 120 - 150 rounds through it.  The scope is zeroed at 200 yards right now and shoots dead on at any distance less than that.  It should zero easily to around a half mile. The scope picks up so much light that you have to use both sun shades in full daylight, and I think it would probably be great for coyote hunting.  I bought it to hunt elk in Idaho at long range. This is one of the flattest flying rounds ever made.  The scope is actually a target scope and can be adjusted for windage and elevation instantly without tools.  I haven't used it in 4 seasons, and need to cover some bills.  I bought it new in the mid 90's and have taken excellent care of it (cleaned after every use and maintained while shelved for long periods). Serious offers will be considered.

Inspection and sale will take place at my office in downtown Davenport. I will require Iowa issued photo ID (along with permit to purchase, carry permit or law enforcement ID would be a bonus). I will give you a bill of sale that we both sign. You will get the original and I will keep a copy for my records (copies are the main reason for meeting at my office).

title: For Sale:  AR15 Project 90% complete.
postcontent:
Ar 15 project. only reason im selling is i have to repair wifes car...she comes first...or i dont get to buy more toys later. 
Top notch parts through out:
Receiver is matched Black Rain ordnance "Fallout 15" skulls milled receivers. these are heavy milled aluminum  upper lower set. not light weight like found on most AR's. 
Barrel is a 20" Stoner Stainless steel bull barrel with threaded muzzle chambered in .223 Wylde. 
Hand guards are Samson manufacturing 12.37 inch with modular rail pieces and full length top rail. This is a free float hand guard that is as rigid as any ive held before.
Military spec extension tube and Magpul STR 6 position collapsible stock that has magpul's lock system to keep it form accidentally collapsing. Also has battery storage and small tool storage in stock. 
Rifle is bloody heavy. this was built form the ground up to be a target rifle. Scope is a cheap barska that was never zeroed. Rings are from local store and are heavy milled aluminum with thumb screws. 
The Bolt is from Les Baer custom shop. good little bolts.
I have at this time a Adams Arms gas PISTON rifle length system installed. This is the gas block, gas regulator, piston, and bolt carrier. 
Problem: in building this and working with the engineers at Adams Arms we have found that the kit is incompatible with the .223 Wylde chambering. This chambering does not create the pressure needed to fulling activate the the piston and leads to short stroking. Rifle will fire first round but fails to auto load the 2nd round. Rifle was dead on at 100 yards. Local Gunshop/Ar15 armorer inspected and saw no other issues other than what Adams Arms engineers were stating. 
Rifle needs the following to function: Barrel in 5.56mm, or remove adams arms and place a regular gas system with bolt carrier on/in rifle and will fire fine. I have done so by tearing apart another AR and doing just that. I intended to sell either barrel or kit and work on this rifle more..but wifes car comes first. Rifle SOLD AS NEEDING FINISHED! Asking price below NEW parts for this build as rifle has had 30 total rounds through it. 15 to tinker with gas piston system and 15 to test with impingement system which ran flawless. I am selling with adams arms kit and selling rifle for less than parts cost. add it up yourself and see. comes with all seen. scope and rings included as is an old Hard Case.

title: For Sale:  Kimber Pro Carry Pre-Series II .45ACP
postcontent:
***Private Sale / Privately Owned Firearm***

***You must be legally eligible to own/purchase/possess firearms under federal and state law in order to purchase this handgun***

Email through Armslist.

Located in Bailey.  I may be able to meet in the Conifer/Aspen Park area.

_______________

This is a highly desirable, pre-Series II Kimber Pro Carry.  For those who don't know Kimber started installing a firing pin block safety on the Series II guns.  This one was built like a 1911 was meant to be built...no firing pin block.  It has a very nice trigger, a 4" barrel, alloy frame and Meprolight night sights that are still bright and serviceable.  This gun includes the original Kimber case (the sticker is gone, though), the little Kimber take-down tool, owner's manual and 3 Kimber mags.  

It does show some signs of use but nothing serious (other than the idiot mark under the slide-lock lever).  Someone polished the feed ramp at some point but it appears to be fairly light.  The screw slot on the lower, left-side grip screw bushing is chewed up a little but nothing that affects the gun or that you can see.  Just wanted to mention that in the interest of full disclosure.

The gun functions perfectly with all types of ammo except CCI Blazer (aluminum).  It just WILL NOT feed Blazer ammo.  Everything else I've tried works great and the gun is very accurate.  

This gun is in remarkably good shape considering it's probably 11+ years old.

No trades.

title: For Sale:  HK USC 45 ACP
postcontent: This is the HK USC in black. It's chambered in .45ACP. A nice thumper of a round! I'm partial to the heavier calibers for shooting people. I'll let my description wander over the weapon. The barrel is serialized to the gun. That's unusual. There is a forward sling attachment with rings on left and right. The forearm has threaded inserts left and right for mounting accessory rails. The front sight has a full protective hood. The left side charging handle is HK familiar. It only takes about four inches to charge the weapon. There is a left side bolt release that you'll immediately recognize as like the M16. There is a two position selector switch that, although it throws in the correct direction (down for fire) and is ambidextrous, it could have been larger to make it easier to reach. From a firing grip, I can't reach it without shifting my hand hold. The grip is nice and full, a little blocky. The length of pull from the trigger face to the rear of the buttpad is 14.25 inch

title: For Sale:  M3HB M2HB M3 M2 .50 BMG 50 Cal
postcontent:
Browning M3HB .50 BMG Belt-Fed 

Other Belt-Fed Auctions listed below

The Browning M3 aircraft gun is an extensively modified M2 aircraft gun that could be fired remotely by the pilot or gunner of a jet aircraft, helicopter or light fixed-wing aircraft. The gun is distinguished by a massive pneumatic buffer at the rear of the receiver. The gun was extensively used on late 1940s and early 1950s fighters until supplanted by 20mm cannons. No sights are furnished on the gun because the sights are considered a part of the airplane. Changes to the M3 gun relative to the M2 are: the bolt assembly, oil buffer body, and barrel extension are modified. The pneumatic buffer on the M3 is designed to absorb the greater recoil forces attendant to the gun's higher cyclic rate. The most famous use of the M3 was by the American F-86 Sabres against the Communist MiG-15s during the Korean War. Also used F-80, F-84, F-94, T-33, B-45, B-52, UH-1, HH-53.

Here are some other selling points about the differences between a M2 and a M3

Depressor's riveted into side-plate's, (VS. part of buffer group due to High breakage rate in M2's)
Air buffer ,No need for adjustment (All new Military M2's use the Air buffer)
Heavier belt lift capacity (M2 18lbs/M3 35lbs)
Improved extractor
Split lower feed pawl (Less Belt jams)
Wider upper feed pawl (Less belt jams) 

Probably Collectible?  There is no doubt that this will become a very collectable weapon for a variety of reasons.  This is a Heavy Barrel version of the M3AC converted for ground use, Semi-Auto.

title: For Sale:  2~7X32B Variable Power Scope Kit for Mauser K98 Style Rifles
postcontent:
Includes:
- 2~7x32MM WIDE ANGLE VARIABLE POWER SCOUT SCOPE -
- NEW MAUSER 98K LOW POFILE SCOPE MOUNT –
- LOW PROFILE SCOPE RINGS –

- $94.00 Includes Free Shipping to Any US Address -

= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = 
NO FIREARMS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS SALE!
= = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = = =

For most large ring Mauser style rifles and carbines based on the German 98K design with a flip-up rear sight hinged in the front and including the Turkish M24/47, Czech VZ 24, German Model GEW 98, KAR 98, Yugo M48, Persian (Iran) copies of the Czech M24, Argentine 1909, Spanish 1943, and others based on the original 1898 Mauser design.

The Mauser 8x57 cartridge is in the same class as the American 30-06 and is popular for hunting big game in the United States. Take advantage of the inherent accuracy of your Mauser carbine or rifle by adding this 2-7x32MM scout scope and increase your rifle’s effective hunting range by 250 yards or more.  Most big game is taken at ranges under 100 yards, but for those long shots across a pasture or from a hill top, this variable power scope provides a wide range of magnification to see your target out to 350 yards or more.

SCOPE SPECIFICATIONS:
 + Variable Power 2~7X
+  Wide Angle View
 + Objective Lens: 32mm
 + One Inch Tube
 + Weight: 9.0 Ounces
 + Length: 10 3/8 inches
 + Duplex Reticle
 + Extended Eye Relief
 + Matte Black Finish
 + Windage/Elevation: 1 Click = 1/4" @100 Yards
 + Multi-Coated Lenses
 + Bright Optics
 + Sharp Focusing
 + Eye Piece Focus Lock Ring
 + Nitrogen Filled - Fog and Water Proof
 + Shock Proof – Heavy Duty Recoil Design
 + Protective Lens Caps Included
 + New in Box with Manufacturer’s Limited Lifetime Warranty *

SCOPE MOUNT SPECIFICATIONS:
This new scout scope mount has been designed with CROSS BOLT mounting and a locking nut to insure a solid and rigid installation. We also include low rings to provide low visual alignment mounting of the 2~7x32MM scout scope.

+ For most Mauser 98K caliber 7.9mm (8x57) Rifles with original Mil-Spec rear sights
+ No modifications to rifle required
+ Easy Installation - "No Gunsmithing" Mount Replaces Rear Sight – Bolts Directly into Rear Sight Base
+ Hardened Matte Black Aluminum Mount with Multiple Picatinny Rail Slots - accepts Weaver Style Rings
+ One Piece High Tensile Strength Alloy Steel Mounting Bolt with Locking Nut – other scope mounts are made of soft aluminum and use two short screws which can strip the aluminum mount threads or break from the heavy recoil of this rifle.**
+ Allen wrenches and adjusting screws included.
+ Use with Extended Eye Relief (EER) Scopes, Hologram and Red Dot Sights with long or unlimited eye relief. Standard short eye relief scopes will not work with this mount.
+ Installation Instructions Included
+ Easily Restore Rifle to Original Configuration by Removing the Scope Mount and Reinstalling the Rear Sight
+ New Mount with Manufacturer’s One Year Replacement Warranty

Some vendors are selling mounts that use two short bolts threaded into the sides of the mount through the “ears” of the rear sight base.  With extended shooting these bolts strip out the threads in the aluminum scope mount and the mount becomes loose.  Our mount has been threaded completely through and is fitted with a full length threaded cross bolt and retaining nut that securely attaches the scope mount to the rear sight base. This mount will not shoot loose.

RINGS SPECIFICATIONS:
+ Strong Lightweight Aluminum
+ Non-Slip Mounting
+ Matte Black Finish
+ Low Profile
+ One Inch Diameter
+ New in Box
+ Fits Weaver Style Bases or Picatinny Rail
+ Note: Rings Style May Vary Slightly from those shown in Photos
+ New Scope Rings with Manufacturer’s One Year Replacement Warranty

PLEASE READ TERMS OF REPLACEMENT WARRANTIES BEFORE ORDERING!!

WARRANTIES:

The individual components of this SCOPE KIT are warranted by their respective manufacturers to be free of defects by reasons of workmanship and/or defective materials. The warranties do not cover damage caused by improper installation, abuse or accidents and no other warranties are offered or implied.  If one or more of the components fails to function properly and/or is found to be otherwise defective it/they will be repaired or replaced as follows:

* Scope: Buyer must return the scope, shipping prepaid, to the manufacturer for inspection and testing.  If found to be defective, the manufacturer will repair or replace the scope and return it directly to the purchaser.

* Mount and Rings: Buyer must return the mount and/or rings to the seller for inspection and testing. If found to be defective, the seller will replace the mount and/or rings and return them directly to the purchaser.

* No other warranties are offered or implied and cash refunds are not offered by the seller.

PAYMENT TERMS:
+ Payment by PayPal in U.S. dollars.
+ Colorado buyers please add 4.9% sales tax.

SHIPPING: 
+ Orders are shipped by USPS Domestic Priority Mail within three business days after receipt of payment to the address specified in your PayPal payment.
+ Please insure that your address and telephone number are correct.
+ We print shipping labels, tracking data and postage on the US Post Office web site.
+ If you receive First Class and Priority Mail at a Post Office Box, do not use a street address that is not in the Post Office data base.
+ Address must be certified by PayPal. If NOT certified, we will ship to the address specified by PayPal, but will not be responsible for shipping to the wrong address.

If unsatisfied with our products or service, please notify us immediately so that we can resolve any issues you may have.

Thank you for purchasing our scope kits.

Ronhart International
Monument, CO USA
